result.execSummary:
The defendant Trebien M Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trebien M Taylor

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Defendant Trebien M Taylor in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Trebien M Taylor.  Attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

State moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct Ordinance 11-6
Plea to amended charge:  GUILTY   
BTC: GUILTY.  
$150+Court Costs, $50 per month/beginning: October 1, 2022, failure to pay 1 year driver's license suspension.

9:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trebien M Taylor in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Trebien M Taylor. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense needs more time to negotiate with the State but is hoping to get this matter resolved. 
BTC: Matter set for a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Notice of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim T.J (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Trebien M Taylor appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter for Trebien M Taylor appeared by video. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
